text: <extra_id_0> RIP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Kinase - dependent Activation of Akt Contributes to Necroptosis

Given our observation that growth factors are important for zVAD.fmk induced death , we examined the contribution of several pathways , including MAPK pathways and Akt , which are known to be activated following growth factor receptor activation ( Fig . 2A ) .

Inhibition of Akt ( Akt inhibitor VIII ) strongly protected the cells from growth factor-sensitive necroptosis induced by zVAD.fmk [ 16 ] as well as cell death triggered by <extra_id_0> bFGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> IGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / zVAD.fmk under serum free conditions ( Fig . 2B ) .
Inhibition of Akt also protected the cells from growth-factor insensitive death by caused by <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Fig . 2A ) .
Consistent with previous reports , the JNK inhibitor SP600125 protected the cells from both zVAD.fmk and <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced death ( Fig . 2A , B and Fig .

In contrast , inhibition of two other MAPKs , p38 and ERK , previously reported not to be activated during necroptosis [ 14 ] , did not protect from either zVAD.fmk or <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced death ( Fig . 2A ) .
Next , we used two approaches to further validate the role of Akt in necroptotic cell death .

First , two additional Akt inhibitors , a highly specific , allosteric kinase inhibitor MK-2206 [ 25 ] and triciribine ( TCN ) [ 26 ] , which blocks membrane translocation of Akt , both attenuated cell death ( Fig .
S2B ) .

Secondly , simultaneous knockdown of Akt isoforms <extra_id_0> Akt1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Akt2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> using siRNAs protected cells from necroptosis induced by both zVAD.fmk and <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Fig . 2C ) .
No expression of <extra_id_0> Akt3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was seen in L929 cells ( Fig .
S2C ) and , consistently , <extra_id_0> Akt3 siRNA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had no additional effect on necroptosis .
Our results confirmed that Akt plays a key role in necroptosis induced by multiple stimuli in L929 cells .

To understand the activation of Akt and JNK under necroptotic conditions , we examined the changes in Akt and JNK phosphorylation at 9 hrs post zVAD.fmk and <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation .
This time point was chosen because it reflects the early stage of cell death in our system ( Fig .
S3A , B ) .

Following stimulation with either zVAD.fmk or <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> we observed a robust increase in Akt phosphorylation at a known major activation site , Thr308 ( Fig . 3A ) .
Interestingly , we did not observe concomitant phosphorylation changes in the second major activation site of Akt , Ser473 .

We also observed an increase in the phosphorylation of both the <extra_id_0> p46 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p54 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> isoforms of JNK and its major substrate <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Fig . 3A ) .
These data indicate that both Akt and JNK are activated under necroptotic conditions .

The <extra_id_0> RIP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kinase inhibitor , Nec-1 , completely prevented the increase in Thr308 <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation , while Nec-1i did not ( Fig . 3A , Fig .
S1D ) .
Similarly , Nec-1 prevented the induction of JNK phosphorylation in response to zVAD.fmk and substantially reduced this change after <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> addition .
We observed some changes in total protein levels of JNK and <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> following necroptotic stimulation .
Some of these changes , e.g . zVAD.fmk - induced increase in <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , were also attenuated by Nec-1 .
Importantly , Nec-1 did not alter the basal phosphorylation levels of either Akt or JNK ( Fig . 3A ) .
This established that Akt Thr308 and JNK phosphorylation during necroptosis is <extra_id_0> RIP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dependent .

Interestingly , we discovered that the phosphorylation of Akt Thr308 , JNK and Jun are late events following zVAD.fmk stimulation ( Fig . 3B ) that coincide with the onset of necroptosis at 6 hr post - stimulation ( Fig .
S3A ) .

To better understand the contributions of growth factors and <extra_id_0> RIP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kinase to necroptotic regulation of Akt , we next analyzed the time course of these phosphorylation changes under serum free conditions .

We found that the addition of <extra_id_0> bFGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone or in combination with zVAD.fmk led to a substantial rapid and transient increase in both Thr308 and Ser473 phosphorylation of Akt as well as JNK and <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> at 15 minutes , reflecting the expected response to growth factor stimulation ( Fig . 3C ) .

Significantly , the combination of <extra_id_0> bFGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / zVAD.fmk , but not <extra_id_0> bFGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone , also caused a robust , second , delayed increase in the phosphorylation of Thr308 , but not Ser473 , of Akt as well as a delayed increase in the phosphorylation of JNK and Jun .

Furthermore , Nec-1 had no significant effect on the early increase in both Akt and JNK / <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation triggered by both <extra_id_0> bFGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> bFGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / zVAD , while Nec-1 , but not its inactive analog Nec-1i ( Fig .

S1E ) , efficiently blocked the <extra_id_0> bFGF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / zVAD increase at 6-9 hr ( Fig . 3D ) , suggesting that only the delayed activation of Akt and JNK is specific for necroptosis and dependent on <extra_id_0> RIP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kinase activity .

Similarly , IGF / zVAD , which also promoted cell death under serum free conditions , produced a delayed increase in Thr308 phosphorylation on Akt , while IGF alone caused solely an early , transient increase in phosphorylation ( Fig .
S3C ) .

We confirmed the kinetics of the Akt Thr308 and Ser473 phosphorylation changes using a quantitative ELISA assay , which also showed a robust delayed necroptosis - specific <extra_id_0> RIP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent increase in Akt Thr308 phosphorylation ( Fig .
S3D , E ) .

Taken together , these results indicate that the observed delayed increases in Akt and JNK phosphorylation , preceding the onset of cell death , represent specific consequences of necroptotic signaling downstream from <extra_id_0> RIP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kinase .
